intro: Celsia suworowiana var. acuminata, commonly known as the Acuminata Celsia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
